definition: to be on duty (of a security guard etc)

sentences.english: Half the garrison are on duty.
sentences.chinese: 有半数卫戍部队在执勤。

sentences.english: Any railway worker when carrying out transport safety inspection shall bear an on-duty identification sign.
sentences.chinese: 实施运输安全检查的铁路职工应当佩戴执勤标志。

sentences.english: So many people have flu that hardly any policemen reported for duty.
sentences.chinese: 患流行性感冒的人太多，连去执勤的警察也寥寥无几。

sentences.english: A mobile guard was posted at the door of the shop, a gun slung over his shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 一个机动宪兵队队员背着枪在面包店门口执勤。

sentences.english: The paper is intended to provide some useful reference material for the management communication of armed police detachment on duty.
sentences.chinese: 希望能为武警执勤支队的管理沟通提供一些参考意见。

sentences.english: Civilization on duty, being polite, do not say dirty words.
sentences.chinese: 文明执勤，礼貌待人，不讲脏话。

sentences.english: Half the garrison is/are on duty.
sentences.chinese: 有半数卫戍部队在执勤。

sentences.english: They assured me that they would have adequate security on the ground today and for every day to come.
sentences.chinese: 他们向我保证今天及以后将会有足够的安全人员执勤。

definition: variant of 執勤|执勤[zhi2 qin2]
traffic police/abbr. for 交通警察
to dispatch police to the scene of crime, accident etc
group/a large body of/production brigade/military group
to search for and seize (criminals, smuggled goods etc)
civil police/PRC police/abbr. for 人民警察
